html: Bird; Cyrus, whose rapid conquests are thus denoted. (Calmet) — He chose a golden eagle, with wings expanded, for his standard. (Xenophon vii.) — Christ came from heaven to redeem the world, Psalm xviii. 6., and Malachias iv. 2. (Calmet) — He was the orient, adored by the eastern sages, to whom the prophet refers. (St. Jerome) (Worthington)
